results.title: Carotid Artery Temperature Reduction with Statin Therapy in Patients with Familial Hyperlipidemia Syndromes
results.text_hl: In the present study, we aimed to investigate the impact of hypolipidemic therapy either with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or with combination @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ on carotid artery temperatures of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@familial hyperlipidemia syndromes@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@FHS@@@).

citations.NLM: Benetos G, Galanakos S, Koutagiar I, Skoumas I, Oikonomou G, Drakopoulou M, Karmpalioti M, Katsi V, Tsioufis C, Toutouzas K. Carotid Artery Temperature Reduction with Statin Therapy in Patients with Familial Hyperlipidemia Syndromes J Clin Med. 2021 Oct 27;10(21):. PMID: 34768528
citations.BibTeX: @article{34768528, title={Carotid Artery Temperature Reduction with Statin Therapy in Patients with Familial Hyperlipidemia Syndromes}, author={Benetos G and Galanakos S and Koutagiar I and Skoumas I and Oikonomou G and Drakopoulou M and Karmpalioti M and Katsi V and Tsioufis C and Toutouzas K}, journal={J Clin Med}, volume={10}, number={21}}

results.title: Simvastatin improves chylomicron remnant removal in familial combined hyperlipidemia without changing chylomicron conversion.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ improves chylomicron remnant removal in @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@familial combined hyperlipidemia@@@ without changing chylomicron conversion.

citations.NLM: Cabezas MC, de Bruin TW, Kock LA, Kortlandt W, Van Linde-Sibenius Trip M, Jansen H, Erkelens DW. Simvastatin improves chylomicron remnant removal in familial combined hyperlipidemia without changing chylomicron conversion. Metabolism. 1993 Apr;42(4):497-503. PMID: 8487674
citations.BibTeX: @article{8487674, title={Simvastatin improves chylomicron remnant removal in familial combined hyperlipidemia without changing chylomicron conversion.}, author={Cabezas MC and de Bruin TW and Kock LA and Kortlandt W and Van Linde-Sibenius Trip M and Jansen H and Erkelens DW}, journal={Metabolism}, volume={42}, number={4}, pages={497-503}}

results.title: Safety and efficacy of long-term statin-fibrate combinations in patients with refractory familial combined hyperlipidemia.
results.text_hl: The present study investigated the safety and efficacy of combined pravastotin or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Gemfibrozil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015248 @@@gemfibrozil@@@ or @CHEMICAL_ciprofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C019304 @@@ciprofibrate@@@ treatment on total @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@, LDL, @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@TG@@@, plasma @GENE_FGB @GENE_2244 @@@fibrinogen@@@, and apoproteins B and A-I in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with refractory @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@familial combined hyperlipidemia@@@, with or without @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Athyros VG, Papageorgiou AA, Hatzikonstandinou HA, Didangelos TP, Carina MV, Kranitsas DF, Kontopoulos AG. Safety and efficacy of long-term statin-fibrate combinations in patients with refractory familial combined hyperlipidemia. Am J Cardiol. 1997 Sep 1;80(5):608-13. PMID: 9294990
citations.BibTeX: @article{9294990, title={Safety and efficacy of long-term statin-fibrate combinations in patients with refractory familial combined hyperlipidemia.}, author={Athyros VG and Papageorgiou AA and Hatzikonstandinou HA and Didangelos TP and Carina MV and Kranitsas DF and Kontopoulos AG}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={80}, number={5}, pages={608-13}}

results.title: [Familial combined hyperlipidemia with particularly severe and premature arteriosclerotic lesions. Description of a case].
results.text_hl: A diagnosis was made of @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@familial combined hyperlipidemia@@@ and treatment was begun with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, which produced a progressive normalization of lipidic picture, without any effect of the symptoms related to @DISEASE_Arterial_calcification_of_infancy @DISEASE_MESH:C537440 @@@lower limb occlusive arteriopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Brocchieri A, Merlo EM, Saporiti A, Grignani G. [Familial combined hyperlipidemia with particularly severe and premature arteriosclerotic lesions. Description of a case]. Minerva Med. 1996 May;87(5):237-42. PMID: 8700349
citations.BibTeX: @article{8700349, title={[Familial combined hyperlipidemia with particularly severe and premature arteriosclerotic lesions. Description of a case].}, author={Brocchieri A and Merlo EM and Saporiti A and Grignani G}, journal={Minerva Med}, volume={87}, number={5}, pages={237-42}}

results.title: Comparison of gemfibrozil versus simvastatin in familial combined hyperlipidemia and effects on apolipoprotein-B-containing lipoproteins, low-density lipoprotein subfraction profile, and low-density lipoprotein oxidizability.
results.text_hl: Comparison of @CHEMICAL_Gemfibrozil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015248 @@@gemfibrozil@@@ versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@familial combined hyperlipidemia@@@ and effects on @GENE_APOB @GENE_338 @@@apolipoprotein-B@@@-containing lipoproteins, low-density lipoprotein subfraction profile, and low-density lipoprotein oxidizability.

citations.NLM: Bredie SJ, de Bruin TW, Demacker PN, Kastelein JJ, Stalenhoef AF. results.title: Treatment with statins and involvement of the peripheral nervous system: results of a prospective clinical and neurophysiological follow-up.
results.journal: Biomed Pap Med Fac Univ Palacky Olomouc Czech Repub
results.text_hl: Subsequently, treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20mg daily was initiated.

results.title: Comparisons of apolipoprotein B levels estimated by immunoassay, nuclear magnetic resonance, vertical auto profile, and non-high-density lipoprotein cholesterol in subjects with hypertriglyceridemia (SAFARI Trial).
results.text_hl: .@@@ This study compared total apolipoprotein estimated by immunonephelometric assay (INA), vertical auto profile (VAP), nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), and non-HDL @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertriglyceridemia @DISEASE_MESH:D015228 @@@hypertriglyceridemia@@@ from the previously reported @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@Fenofibrate@@@ for Combined @DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@Hyperlipidemia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemia_Familial_Combined</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006950 @@@SAFARI@@@) trial.

citations.NLM: Grundy SM, Vega GL, Tomassini JE, Tershakovec AM. Comparisons of apolipoprotein B levels estimated by immunoassay, nuclear magnetic resonance, vertical auto profile, and non-high-density lipoprotein cholesterol in subjects with hypertriglyceridemia (SAFARI Trial). Am J Cardiol. 2011 Jul 1;108(1):40-6. PMID: 21565322
